Name: Kir Royale
Ingredients: 15 ml Joseph Cartron Double Crème de Cassis de Bourgogne
Instructions: POUR cassis into glass and TOP with champagne.
Review: Champagne replaces Bourgogne Aligoté white wine in this 'Royal' rendition of Mayor Canon Kir's classic apéritif. Easy to make, easy to drink.
History: A sparkling version of the Kir Apéritif which is thought to have first been mixed in 1904 at Café George in Dijon, France. It is named after Canon Félix Kir who promoted the mixture while Mayor of Dijon. Kir and Kir Royale history
